Employee: Former  Server  in Lake Zurich, Illinois
Description: [' The on shift and off shift discounts are low for the status level of the company.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Enfield, Connecticut
Description: [' When we went from a corporately own restaurant to a franchised restaurant, many benefits were reduced, and some were eliminated. One of these was college reimbursement. Many employees were surprised acnddissapointed by this news.']

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Chicago, Illinois
Description: [' Before the company went to a franchise model when it was under the Carlson umbrella benefits were in line with market and results. After franchise the benefits became worse and worse way below industry average even compared to fast food.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Benefits vary widely depending on your level in the company.']

Employee: Current  Bar Manager  in Garland, Texas
Description: [' Best is they offer insurance worst in the deductible and no maternity leave was avavaible either.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Massapequa, New York State
Description: [' After you work six months you get a card that you can use at any Fridays in the United States']

Employee: Former  Server  in Ledgewood, New Jersey
Description: [' I worked there for almost 2 years, averaging between 30 and 40 hours a week and never saw vacation time. Benefits package was offered but was expensive and useless.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Lancaster, Pennsylvania
Description: [" There is no guaranteed time off for servers, just which ever days you request off (if they choose to give you those days off) and whatever time you're not scheduled. There is no health insurance or 401k for servers. The only perk is the small discount on food. Half off a meal as long as the meal is under $10. If the meal is over $10, you get $5 off the meal."]

Employee: Former  Host/Hostess  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [" The health insurance is if you work 40+ hours a week. (Which you won't)"]

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Melbourne, Florida
Description: [" They do offer health insurance but I heard it's still outrageously expensive."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Key West, Florida
Description: [' You have to be with the company a long time to receive any benefits']

Employee: Former  Server  in Bensalem, Pennsylvania
Description: [" It's better than having no health benefits but it's expensive and limited coverage"]

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Rockville Centre, New York State
Description: [" The packages don't seem that useful to be quite honest, but I guess it is better than nothing !"]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Mary Esther, Florida
Description: [' They offer 10k free life insurance policy and free health insurance to non smokers. The health insurance plan, dental and vision is fairly inexpensive and they offer HSA as well']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Providence, Rhode Island
Description: [' The benefits were pretty much normal for corporate restaurant. After 20 you get 1 month sabbatical. If you were lucky to make it that long. I found out after 10 years they try to get rid of you, that way they can hire someone new with little vacation (5 years) time .']

Employee: Former  Host  in Houston, Texas
Description: [' There were really no other benefits except the employee discount on food, and paid vacation, which I never took advantage of.']

Employee: Former  Assistant General Manager  in Austin, Texas
Description: [' When Marlu Group took over the benefits went away. As a KM the most i bonus-ed was $300. and i hit every number! they dont even have direct deposit.']

Employee: Former  Server/Waitress  in Sandusky, Ohio
Description: [' Seasonal, so no benefits of any kind. Fun place to work if regular restaurant not a seasonal position at amusement park']

Employee: Former  Bartender  in Oak Park, Illinois
Description: [" benefits are okay the vision insurance was horrible had used the full benefit and hadn't even gotten my contacts yet, health insurance was better but the insurance company would give give you incorrect information repeatedly causing you to make wrong and costly choices"]

Employee: Former  Server/Waiter  in Sandy, Utah
Description: [" Each shift, we were allowed 50% off our shift meal up to $4. Kind of cheap but it's better than nothing."]

Employee: Former  Restaurant FOH Manager  in Atlanta, Georgia
Description: [' 401k and vacation are the okay things....worst is the removal of free healthcare']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Pottstown, Pennsylvania
Description: [" Employee discounts, Great food, wonderful place. Just work here to find out more. I promise it's amazing. You won't regret it if you do."]

Employee: Current  Director  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Healthcare is pretty good, cost for single person is affordable. High deductible makes some services such as lab tests very expensive initially.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Columbus, Georgia
Description: [" Benefits are offered, but you have to meet to many requirements to qualify for the benefits as an hourly employee , and then you can't afford them"]

Employee: Former  Field Marketing Manager  in Washington, District of Columbia
Description: [' over priced for what you get and poor communication, changed plans every year, poor dental coverage, high out of pocket max, drugs very expensive sometimes']

Employee: Current  Server  in Auburn Hills, Michigan
Description: [' Tips were great as long as you can conduct yourself well and talk to customers.']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Manchester, New Hampshire
Description: [' they seal benefits from there emlpoyees']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Cherry Hill, New Jersey
Description: [' High cost for family plan with high deductibles and co-pay.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Saint Louis, Missouri
Description: [' Changed it to frequently, had to resign up each time. Very minimum offered and not notified in timely matter of changes.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Roswell, Georgia
Description: [' No benefits for part time workers, made it difficult to survive']

Employee: Former  Kitchen Staff  in Minneapolis, Minnesota
Description: [' It was okay, I did not apply to get the benefits because I did not need them. They do give a weeks paid vacation, which you can use after you are there for a year.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Indianapolis, Indiana
Description: [' The benefit package comes at a fair price.']

Employee: Current  Server/Waiter  in Phoenix, Arizona
Description: [' They do not offer many benefits for staff. The medical insurance is one of the worst']

Employee: Current  Manager  in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Description: [' Health Insurance is the worst. Vacation time is the best.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Tampa, Florida
Description: [' Part timers get no assistance']

Employee: Current  Server/Waiter  in Cincinnati, Ohio
Description: [' I am a part time employee and also a student. I was able to get great life insurance, medical, dental, etc. through my company which is something that is rare, especially in the serving industry']

Employee: Former  Server/Waitress  in Bloomington, Indiana
Description: [' Took no benefits. I was purely a part time employee, but the health package sounded good for those in management and serving/ bartending full time.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Hollywood, Florida
Description: [" There's stuff like 401k, health, and vision/dental. I believe the requirement to get these was 30+ hours, and even though I made those hours almost always, I never signed up or needed it. So I don't know how good these benefits actually were."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Vacation is ok, starts at 3 weeks, Health care ok too. 401k matching not ok, not great, they reduce the matching amount in 2015.']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Jacksonville, Florida
Description: [" you get one week paid vacation every year. the insurance there is terrible there's a 5000 dollar deductible."]

Employee: Current  Server  in Huntsville, Alabama
Description: [' There is No benefits package included in working at Fridays']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Concord, North Carolina
Description: [' you have to work there for a year to get benefits its bs']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Carrollton, Texas
Description: [" When I worked there, Friday's offered a complete benefit's package including medical, dental, vision, short term and long term disability, paid time off, vacation and sick time as well as 401k with employer match. Another great perk was a 4 week sabbatical after 20 years of service with an addition 4 week sabbatical every 5 years thereafter."]

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Chicago, Illinois
Description: [' The best thing is the employee created credit union']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Grand Rapids, Michigan
Description: [' company matching 401k, vacation with paid time off']

Employee: Former  Server  in City of Industry, California
Description: [' 50% off of meals, but the caveat is UP TO $5. However, after three years you get a Red card which takes off the restriction of up to $5 and increases it to $100 excluding alcohol.']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Mayfield Heights, Ohio
Description: [' provides very good coverage but is very expensive']

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Buffalo, New York State
Description: [' Terrible coverage, huge out of pocket expenses. It is great that TGI Fridays does provide full time employment so that hourly employees have access to insurance.']

Employee: Former  Server/Waiter  in North Brunswick, New Jersey
Description: [" there wasn't any?? not that i can recall. had to pay out of pocket for insurance despite working over 40 hours a week as a server."]

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' It is decent coverage, but it is very expensive. I am currently paying over $800 per month for family coverage. Medical and dental are pretty standard $20 co pay plans, but ancillary offerings like life insurance are sparse (the provided life is $10K).']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Braintree, Massachusetts
Description: [' It did offer a lot previously, but not as much since changing companies']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Farmingville, New York State
Description: [' you must work 30 hours per week to be eligible']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in New York, New York State
Description: [' Its horrendous, to expensive for what you are getting payed']

Employee: Former  Host/Server  in Cary, North Carolina
Description: [" Best: 50% off everything (except alcohol). Worst: You only get the 50% discount after you've been working there for 3 years."]

Employee: Current  Host/Hostess  in Auburn Hills, Michigan
Description: [' Since I worked part-time, I did not receive any of this.']

Employee: Former  Hostess  in West Nyack, New York State
Description: [' They do not give you one']

Employee: Former  Food Server  in Batavia, Illinois
Description: [' There was not exactly a benefit package. I mean there was a 401K option but at the time I thought I needed every dollar I earned and did not invest.']

Employee: Former  Waitess   in Atlanta, Georgia
Description: [' Nothing for servers unless you have been with them over a year as far as insurance you can say good bye to a great portion of your check']

Employee: Current  Cook  in Valparaiso, Indiana
Description: [" 401 k, Flexible scheduling is good. We used to get vacation time but now we don't even for full time. Dental insurance is ok. 50% off meals during shift, 25% off outside of work, they keep switching if we can go to any location or just our store though."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Charlotte, North Carolina
Description: [' No benefits for part-time employees except 50% discount']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Aurora, Colorado
Description: [' Must wait 90 days for benefit package to kick in. Because work pay is tip based on bad work weeks the amount taken out for insurance could really set someone back if living paycheck to paycheck']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Manchester, Connecticut
Description: [' No benefits for part time employees']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Corona, California
Description: [" You don't receive any of those things. No vacation pay or paid time off. No health insurance was offered to me at the time of employment."]

Employee: Former  Waitress  in South Florida, Florida
Description: [' I personally did not have any benefits, I was part time. However, they were flexible with working around time needed off.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Walker, Michigan
Description: [' Easy to get days off']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [" There are no benefits packages for non-salary workers. Time off is determined by how many people request the same days off and if the managers feel like giving it to you. There's very little in the means of benefits besides a cheaper rate on food while working a shift, though some managers won't give you the discount if you don't eat the food at work."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Massapequa Park, New York State
Description: [' Flexible schedule. If you need days off in advance they accommodate']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in New York, New York State
Description: [' you dont ever get to see the benefits of working there besides the employee 20% discount which is nothing']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Portland, Oregon
Description: [" Working in hospitality benefits are very hard to come by. TGI Fridays is no different. Really unfortunate that they don't take care of their workers."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Midlothian, Virginia
Description: [" There is no benefits package. No PTO, no insurance, no health or dental, medical, etc. So if you're considering this job hoping to get one of those........... Keep looking"]

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Hattiesburg, Mississippi
Description: [' Time off is probably the worst part. Weekends off were pretty much not an option and to ask for time off was met with anger usually. I never requested time off due to this. All holidays were pretty much mandatory as well.']

Employee: Current  Coordinator  in Carrollton, Texas
Description: [" Best thing...you can purchase additional vacation time and have cost taken out by payroll deduction through the year. If you don't use the additional time, the money is refunded at end of the year! Generous vacation time, good medical and a partial match for 401(k) contributions."]

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Grandville, Michigan
Description: [' The Scott France was an awesome Manager']

Employee: Current  Server  in Dickson City, Pennsylvania
Description: [' There are no good benefits for servers']

Employee: Current  Host/Hostess  in Phoenix, Arizona
Description: [' Not many benefits for part time. We got 50% off our shift meal and 20% off if we came in any other time.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Independence, Missouri
Description: [" Decent benefits. My company was owned by franchiser, so they're probably different than corporate."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Westbury, New York State
Description: [' the benefits package was pretty impressive. what i like the most was the free lawyer. helped me beat four speeding tickets and two moving violations. health was pretty good blue cross blue shield']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Miami, Florida
Description: [' time off paid at min wage.']

Employee: Current  Bartender   in Bloomington, Illinois
Description: [' no benefits were available']

Employee: Former  Server  in La Crosse, Wisconsin
Description: [' You get nothing for the first year.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Charlotte, North Carolina
Description: [' Medical, dental and vision offered.']

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Miami, Florida
Description: [' Decent. We were bought by jackmont. 50% maching on 6% for 401k']

Employee: Current  Manager  in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
Description: [' For a franchise, the benefit package is not good. the bonuses are ridiculous, around 100 dollars a more.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [" The health insurance and dental insurance was very costly, especially the family package. The deductible is also too high and you have a limited amount facilities to go to as it's very restricted."]

Employee: Former  emploee  in Miami, Florida
Description: [' Some of the best benefit packages available in the food industry.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Merritt Island, Florida
Description: [' Typical benefits package but they offered tuition reimbursement which was nice.']

Employee: Former  Assistant General Manager  in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Description: [' Full benefits including 401k, solid package- up to 4 weeks vacation']

Employee: Former  Server/Waiter  in Chicago, Illinois
Description: [' I got not benifits even though I worked there 50 hours a week. They would only consider me part-time.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Tampa, Florida
Description: [' Half off most meals, friendly staff environment, training was mostly done on computer for two weeks straight with a free meal every night.']

Employee: Former  Server / Waiter  in Plantation, Florida
Description: [' None, honestly. They mentioned some bogus benefit but nothing applied to anyone except for a few national events such as someone suffering from a natural disaster getting a small check.']

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [" I had four weeks vacation plus one week PTO. As a GM, it's just impossible to take that much time off though. The health insurance was great. Overall, I thought the benefits package was fantastic."]

Employee: Current  Host  in Tulsa, Oklahoma
Description: [' In 60 days you get medical, dental and vision insurance offerings.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Carrollton, Texas
Description: [' Health Insurance, vacation and sick time']

Employee: Former  Culinary Manager  in Willow Grove, Pennsylvania
Description: [' It cost a lot more than others with less actuall benefits to the employee. More out of pocket']

Employee: Current  Bar Manager  in Miami, Florida
Description: [' A robust bonus package was dependent on other managers and GM of your store, with only so much a single manager can do. Also, the company recently changed owners and the bonus structure is changing.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Saratoga Springs, New York State
Description: [' 50% discount on days that you work, %25 when you or family visits. Paid vacation time for average amount of hours you worked per week that year.']

Employee: Former  Server/Waiter  in Melbourne, Florida
Description: [' No benefits through company. Most self centered company ever and only offered insurance once a year through the most expensive insurance company ever.']

Employee: Former  waitress   in Cedar Hill, Texas
Description: [' No benefits with meal discount unless you were on a shift. You had to pay in Way too much to get insurance with them for not that great coverage']

Employee: Former  DIRECTOR  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Fridays has an above average industry benefits package']

Employee: Former  Host/Hostess  in Boston, Massachusetts
Description: [" There is none for part-time workers and they don't offer full-time positions to provide these benefits."]

Employee: Former  Bar Manager  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' Day one health insurance for managers.']

Employee: Former  Kitchen Manager  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' Free food - as a salaried manager you receive a gold card. This card entitles you to free food whether you are working, or simply dining as a guest.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Lake Grove, New York State
Description: [' It is very extensive and their LTD policy helped me and family out a lot.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Description: [' Poor healthcare package, cannot add spouse or children to it.']

Employee: Former  Shift Supervisor  in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Description: [' Offer health insurance, dental and vision. Company matched 401(k), vacation time.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Newington, Connecticut
Description: [' There are no company perks. Because the management and scheduling are so unorganized, you may request time off, and it be denied by mistake.']

Employee: Former  Bartender  in Saint Cloud, Minnesota
Description: [' You get no benefits. None']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Carrollton, Texas
Description: [' The vacation time is great! Work hard but we also have lots of fun.']
